lists.description: Species from Finding Nemo.  Nemo and his father Marlin are clownfish who live in a purple anemone on an Australian reef.  His teacher, a spotted eagle ray, refers to all the students as fish, but some of them are not-- which one is not a fish, Sheldon (seahorse) or Pearl (flapjack octopus)?  On his adventure, Nemo encounters a Regal Tang (Dory), Green sea turtle (Crush), Moorish Idol (Gill), Porcupinefish (Bloat), Royal Gramma (Gurgle), Yellow Tang (Bubbles), Starfish (Peach), Pacific cleaner shrimp (Jacques), Damselfish (Deb, Flo), Mako Shark (Chum), Great White Shark (Bruce), Hammerhead Shark (Anchor), and an Australian Pelican (Nigel)
author: Arlin Stoltzfus
lists.title: Finding Nemo

lists.description: Species from Finding Nemo.  Nemo and his father Marlin are clownfish who live in a purple anemone on an Australian reef.  His teacher, a spotted eagle ray, refers to all the students as fish, but some of them are not-- which one is not a fish, Sheldon (seahorse) or Pearl (flapjack octopus)?  On his adventure, Nemo encounters a Regal Tang (Dory), Green sea turtle (Crush), Moorish Idol (Gill), Porcupinefish (Bloat), Royal Gramma (Gurgle), Yellow Tang (Bubbles), Starfish (Peach), Pacific cleaner shrimp (Jacques), Damselfish (Deb, Flo), Mako Shark (Chum), Great White Shark (Bruce), Hammerhead Shark (Anchor), and an Australian Pelican (Nigel)
author: Arlin Stoltzfus

lists.description: Image forming eyes can be found in craniates (animals with heads, like us), arthropods (beetles, crabs, etc), and molluscs (snail, octupus, etc).  Can you find these three groups in the tree? Did these three kinds of eyes evolve separately?
author: H. Dail Laughinghouse
lists.title: Evolution of eyes

lists.description: Why do scientists sometimes like to say that humans are fish?  Fish are a very diverse group with many branches. Humans, along with all the other tetrapods (the 4-limbed creatures including reptiles, amphibians, birds and mammals), are found on just one branch of the fish tree-- the branch of Sarcopterygians that includes the lungfish (Neoceratodus) and the coelacanth (Latimeria).
author: H. Dail Laughinghouse
lists.title: Our inner fish

lists.description: Are Fungi more closely related to animals or plants?
author: H. Dail Laughinghouse
lists.title: Fungi, animals and plants

lists.description: What is the relationship of birds, mammals and reptiles ?   Mammals and birds are both warm-blooded.  Are they more closely related?  Actually, the birds are a group within the reptiles, related to crocodiles and alligators.  The mammals are separate from the bird-reptile group.  Where do you think the dinosaurs would fall in this tree: with the birds, the crocodiles, the turtles, or the mammals?
author: H. Dail Laughinghouse
lists.title: Birds, reptiles and mammals

lists.description: This tree depicts three groups of mammals that have returned to the water. Can you find the three groups?
author: H. Dail Laughinghouse
lists.title: Mammals return to the water

lists.description: Are seaweeds (algae) monophyletic?  Where are the 'vascular plants' located?  How many groups of seaweeds can you find?
author: H. Dail Laughinghouse
lists.title: Are seaweeds plants?
